page_analysis.text_content:
Contextual front setbacks
Contextual setbacks apply if, and only if, the average of the existing setbacks on the same side of the block
is 30' or greater.
How to determine if a contextual setback applies using Fig 15 below, as an example.
Does block have
more than 3 lots?
(incl project lot)
Note: If block is more
than 600' long,
consider only lots within
600' (max. 10 lots).
Yes Exclude the following types of lots:
• Flag lot (C)
• Multi-family use w/ 3+ units (G)
• Corner lot facing cross street (H)
Is the number of remaining lots more or less
than 5 or more?
Yes
Exclude the smallest and largest
setbacks:
• Smallest (D)
• Largest (E)
Find the average of the remaining
lots (incl. subject lot). If greater
than 30', it applies.
30 (A)
33 (B)
+ 35 (F)
98 ÷ 3 = 32.7
Fig 15 Example of a block with a contextual setback of 32.7'

visual_elements.description: A flowchart illustrating the process to determine if a contextual setback applies. It starts with a question 'Does block have more than 3 lots? (incl project lot)'. If 'Yes', it leads to 'Exclude the following types of lots: Flag lot (C), Multi-family use w/ 3+ units (G), Corner lot facing cross street (H)'. This then leads to 'Is the number of remaining lots more or less than 5 or more?'. If 'Yes', it leads to 'Exclude the smallest and largest setbacks: Smallest (D), Largest (E)'. Finally, it leads to 'Find the average of the remaining lots (incl. subject lot). If greater than 30', it applies.' with a calculation example: '30 (A) + 33 (B) + 35 (F) = 98 ÷ 3 = 32.7'.

A plan view diagram titled 'Fig 15 Example of a block with a contextual setback of 32.7''. It shows a block of land with multiple lots (A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H) and their respective setbacks from the street. Lots A, B, D, E, F are 'Single-Family' with setbacks of 30', 33', 20', 37', and 35' respectively. Lot C is a 'Flag lot'. Lot G is 'Multiple-Family (3 + units)'. Lot H is a 'Lot fronts onto other street' with a 'Street sideyard'. Lots C, D, G, H are crossed out with large 'X' marks, indicating their exclusion from the calculation. The diagram also includes a 'Key' explaining symbols for 'Lot line', 'Sidewalk', 'Curb', 'Required setbacks', 'Buildable area', and 'Existing house'.

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum average existing setback for contextual setbacks to apply
Maximum block length for considering all lots
Maximum number of lots to consider within 600' block
Sum of selected setbacks (A, B, F)
Number of lots used for average calculation
